name: RetrieveWorkers
description:
Retrieve all workers or search by name.

Use this tool to obtain a list of all workers or find specific workers by name. The search is case-insensitive and can be useful for managing or viewing staffing information.

parameters.name: max_objects_per_response
parameters.description: The maximum number of worker records to retrieve per response. Defaults to 20, with a maximum of 100.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: starting_index_for_paging
parameters.description: The zero-based index for the first worker in the response. Default is 0. Useful for paginating results with the limit parameter.

value_schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: worker_search_name
parameters.description: A case-insensitive search term to filter workers by name. Leave empty to retrieve all workers.

parameters.name: include_terminated_workers
parameters.description: Set to true to include terminated workers in the results, false to exclude them.

value_schema.description: Include terminated workers in the output

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Workday API

parameters.name: includeTerminatedWorkers
parameters.description: Include terminated workers in the output

value_schema.description: Include terminated workers in the output

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

value_schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
